oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Man holding chickens
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: African American man holding large chickens by their feet. He may be bartering them. An unidentified river is in the background.

The barter system has existed for centuries. Bartering did not involve money; rather, people exchanged goods or services. It was especially prevalent in rural communities where money was scarce, and it was popular during times of economic depression. Historians believe that bartering was invented by the Mesopotamians around 6000 B.C.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Earl S. Miers River Photograph Collection
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: African Americans; Birds; Chickens; Rivers
